title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Abbott Labs was alerted to allegations concerning problems at an infant-formula plant months earlier than previously publicly known, according to a government official, a person familiar with the matter and documents viewed by the WSJ.

---

Big tech stocks are in the midst of their biggest rout in more than a decade, and some investors are bracing for bigger losses ahead.

---

U.S. stocks ended lower in Wednesday's session, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow shedding 1.1%, 0.7% and 0.8%, respectively.

---

Deloitte is exploring a plan to split its global audit and consulting practices, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Brokerages and trading firms pushed back against SEC Chairman Gensler's proposed changes to U.S. stock-trading rules.

---

Spirit Airlines postponed a planned stockholder meeting on its proposed merger with Frontier as it weighs a bid from JetBlue.

---

The FTC's chief said the agency is considering a new regulation to restrict the use of noncompete clauses by companies.

---

Credit Suisse said its capital position is eroding and that it expects another quarterly loss from weak market conditions and lower earnings in its investment bank.

---

Intel is adjusting some of its near-term spending plans, joining other tech firms in reassessing priorities amid economic uncertainty.
